title: Electric field lines of spherical capacitor

content.question: A spherical capacitor is constructed with a spherical conductor surrounded by a thin spherical conducting shell. The inner sphere carries a charge <math alttext="negative Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the outer shell carries a charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. Which of the following correctly shows the electric field lines for the capacitor?

choices.label: The figure shows a spherical conductor inside a larger spherical conducting shell. Field lines are emitted radially outward from the center of the spheres, and extend beyond the outer sphere.

The figure shows a spherical conductor inside a larger spherical conducting shell. Field lines point inward towards the center from the outer edge of the larger sphere, to the outer edge of the smaller sphere.

The figure shows a spherical conductor inside a larger spherical conducting shell. Field lines point outwards from the center from the outer edge of the smaller sphere, to the outer edge of the larger sphere.
The figure shows a spherical conductor inside a larger spherical conducting shell. Field lines point inward toward the center, and begin outside of the spheres and end at the center of the spheres.
The figure shows a spherical conductor inside a larger spherical conducting shell. No field lines are drawn, and a note indicates that E equals 0 everywhere.

content.answer: The figure shows a spherical conductor inside a larger spherical conducting shell. Field lines point inward towards the center from the outer edge of the larger sphere, to the outer edge of the smaller sphere.
